alert.note: Alert for Cheyenne; Kit Carson County; Yuma (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Fire Weather Watch issued October 18 at 2:55AM MDT until October 19 at 6:00PM MDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...Critical fire weather conditions expected across far eastern Colorado Wednesday afternoon... .The combination of dry fuels, northwest winds gusting up to 35 mph and relative humidity values falling to around 14 percent will create critical fire weather conditions across far eastern Colorado Wednesday afternoon. Outdoor burning should be avoided. ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH IN EFFECT WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON FOR WIND AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR FIRE WEATHER ZONES 252, 253, AND 254... The National Weather Service in Goodland has issued a Fire Weather Watch for wind and low relative humidity, which is in effect Wednesday afternoon. * Affected Area...In Colorado, Fire Weather Zone 252 Yuma, Fire Weather Zone 253 Kit Carson and Fire Weather Zone 254 Cheyenne. * Timing...Noon through 6 PM MDT Wednesday. * Winds...Northwest 15 to 20 mph with gusts up to 35 mph. * Relative Humidity...As low as 14 percent. * Temperatures...In the low to mid 70s. * Impacts...Any fires that start will have extreme fire behavior and spread rapidly. Outdoor burning is not advised. Abrupt wind shifts are not expected.
info.instruction: A Fire Weather Watch means that critical fire weather conditions are forecast to occur. Listen for later forecasts and possible red flag warnings.
